page.title: 01Scotforth area
page.content: The majority of our block is farmland with deciduous trees. It is hilly & is used for grazing cows & sheep. The M6 motorway runs north/south with 6 lanes & 2 hard shoulders, along the valley. The Blea Tarn Reservoir built in 1903 supplies water with two others, to Morcambe, Heysham & Lancaster. The A6 main road runs parallel to the M6 but on the east side carries all the traffic to the University of Lancaster which includes 1400 cars each week day. In 1974 the railway was electrified and runs north to south. The Intercity 125 reaches 125 mph here.The University of Lancaster was opened in 1964 and is built on a plateau on an impressive site. 4000 students study here and 2500 live in the university. It has brought much to the area eg education, recreation employment, trade and culture.
